definition: to wound with a blade or hatchet/to slash/to gash
to chop/to cut down/to throw sth at sb

sentences.english: She put a dressing on the mangled toe.
Suddenly his axe slipped and cut his arm.
sentences.chinese: 突然他的斧头砍伤他的手臂。

sentences.english: After you dressed the cut hand of your own baby woodcutter.
sentences.chinese: 在你把小儿被柴刀砍伤了的手包好之后。

sentences.english: His thigh had been axed open to the bone.
sentences.chinese: 他的大腿被斧头砍伤及骨头。

sentences.english: He slashed the man's wife and a girl drawing well water.
sentences.chinese: 还将一名妇女和一名正从井里打水的女孩砍伤。

sentences.english: He cannot work today; he got a gash in his hand while axing.
sentences.chinese: 他今天不能干活了，他在砍东西时把手砍伤了。

sentences.english: She cut his wrist so badly that blood jetted out.
sentences.chinese: 她把他的手腕砍伤得很厉害，鲜血喷射出来。

sentences.english: He slashed the man’s wife and a girl drawing well water.
sentences.chinese: 还将一名妇女和一名正从井里打水的女孩砍伤。

definition: to hack to death/to kill with an ax
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
violent crime/to commit a violent act (assault or murder)
to damage by scratching/to gash/to lacerate
